meanings.sent1: After the initial mobilization, the remobilization of troops was necessary for the next mission.
meanings.sent2: The remobilization of supplies after the storm ensured that the community had what they needed.
meanings.sent3: The remobilization of the toys in the playroom made the children excited to play again.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project was like the remobilization of a dormant army, ready to conquer new challenges.
meanings.sent5: The remobilization of the workers was swift and efficient, showing their dedication to the task at hand.

meanings.definition: The process of moving resources or personnel back into action.
meanings.sent1: The remobilization of the rescue team was crucial after the natural disaster struck.
meanings.sent2: Efficient remobilization of funds helped the company recover quickly from the financial setback.
meanings.sent3: The remobilization of the forgotten tools in the shed brought a smile to the gardener's face.
meanings.sent4: The remobilization of the dormant factory breathed new life into the once-abandoned industry.
meanings.sent5: With the remobilization of the team, the project was back on track and moving forward smoothly.
